This is a chat only number. true false false false false false false false false false Powered By Digit Digit Insurance Explore Beaches in India Beaches in Andhra Pradesh Switch to Digit Insurance Quick Claim Process Affordable Premium Check Premium Check Premium 16 Best Beaches in Andhra Pradesh to Visit on Your Next Trip Source: travelandleisureindia Andhra Pradesh has a coastline stretch of 975km, lined with breathtaking beaches. Although some of them are widely popular, like Rishikonda and RK beach, there are several other noteworthy beaches in Andhra Pradesh which are equally attractive. Team Digit Table of Contents Best Beaches in Andhra Pradesh Rishikonda Beach, Visakhapatnam Yarada Beach, Yarada Rama Krishna Beach, Visakhapatnam Surya Lanka Beach, Bapatla Mypadu Beach, SPSR Nellore Ramapuram Beach, Prakasam Bheemunipatnam Beach, Visakhapatnam Kothapatnam Beach, Prakasam Appikonda Beach, Visakhapatnam Lawson’s Bay Beach, Visakhapatnam Manginapudi Beach, Krishna Pakala Beach, Prakasam Perupalem Beach, West Godavari Vodarevu Beach, Bapatla Uppada Beach, Kakinada Krishnapatnam Beach, Nellore Frequently Asked Questions List of Beaches in Andhra Pradesh Name of the Beach Location Rishikonda Beach Visakhapatnam Yarada Beach Yarada Rama Krishna Beach Visakhapatnam Surya Lanka Beach Bapatla Mypadu Beach SPSR Nellore Ramapuram Beach Prakasam Bheemunipatnam Beach Visakhapatnam Kothapatnam Beach Prakasam Appikonda Beach Visakhapatnam Lawson’s Bay Beach Visakhapatnam Manginapudi Beach Krishna Pakala Beach Prakasam Perupalem Beach West Godavari Vodarevu Beach Bapatla Uppada Beach Kakinada Krishnapatnam Beach Nellore Best Beaches in Andhra Pradesh If you are a beach person and planning a vacation on the seashores, check the list below which includes some of the most popular beaches in Andhra Pradesh. 1. Rishikonda Beach, Visakhapatnam source: aptourism One of the most popular beaches in this state is Rishikonda. It is located in Vizag, approximately 15.5km from the Vizag railway station. This is also one of the prime attractions of the city. The golden sand beach with palm trees makes it the most idyllic location to relax and enjoy the waves. Best Time to Visit: August to October and January to March Famous for: Here are some of the activities that most individuals visiting Rishikonda like to take part in: Water sports Bird watching Swimming 2. Yarada Beach, Yarada source: wikimedia Yarada Beach falls under the category of famous beaches in Andhra Pradesh. This calm and serene beach offers a picturesque view of the golden sand and the stretch of hills. Bordered by hills on three sides and the Bay of Bengal on the other, this can be your next vacation stop. In contrast to Rishikonda, this is less crowded and yet to be commercialised. Best Time to Visit: November to March Famous for: Here are some of the unique factors that make Yarada such a fine specimen of a getaway destination. Dolphin’s nose  Ross Hill Church 3. Rama Krishna Beach, Visakhapatnam source: tripadvisor Situated on the east coast of the Bay of Bengal in Visakhapatnam, Ramakrishna beach is one of the most popularly known beaches in Andhra Pradesh. Its distance from the main town to this beach is relatively less. Although not suitable for swimming, this beach is the most commercialised. You can spend an entire day on this beach without getting bored. Best Time to Visit: October to February Famous for: Besides rejoicing in the aesthetic surrounding of this beach, you can also take a stroll to the following equally remarkable spots nearby: INS Kurusura Submarine Museum TU 142 AirCraft Museum Matsya Darshini (Aquarium) 4. Surya Lanka Beach, Bapatla source: holidify This beach is in the Guntur district of Andhra Pradesh and is also popular by the name Bapatla Beach. People looking for places to break down their busy monotonous schedule can visit this beach. The wide shore, crystal blue water, and peaceful environment drive tourists to this place. Best Time to Visit: October to March Famous for: Here are some of the activities that most individuals visiting Surya Lanka beach like to: Catch a glimpse of the dolphins Sunbathing Visit the Bhavanarayana Swamy temple 5. Mypadu Beach, SPSR Nellore source: madmansjourney Another lesser explored beach of Andhra Pradesh is Mypadu Beach. This is located on the west coast of the Bay of Bengal and Nellore district of Andhra Pradesh. However, with the initiative of Andhra Pradesh Tourism Development Corporation, this beach is now maintained as tourists’ attraction. Best Time to Visit: October to February Famous for: Here are some of the activities that most individuals visiting Mypadu like to take part in: Fishing Cruising 6. Ramapuram Beach, Prakasam source: tripadvisor Ramapuram beach is located in Chirala, Andhra Pradesh. You can plan to visit here during the winters when it is more pleasant to lay on the beach. This can be an ideal location for those who admire sunrises and sunsets. If you like to relax in solitude and avoid crowds, you can book a resort with private access to the beach. Best Time to Visit: October to February Famous for: Some popular spots near this beach are as follows: St. Mark’s Lutheran Church Local markets 7. Bheemunipatnam Beach, Visakhapatnam source: toiimg Bheemunipatnam or Bheemili beach is located roughly around 29 km away from Visakhapatnam city. This particular beach is among those not-so-famous beaches in Andhra Pradesh because not many people are aware of this marvel. The thick black sand is a major attraction here. Best Time to Visit: October to March Famous for: Some popular spots near this beach are as follows: Sri Kanaka Mahalakshmi Temple Tyda park 8. Kothapatnam Beach, Prakasam source: twimg Kothapatnam is a small coastal village situated in the Prakasam district of Andhra Pradesh. The mesmerising blue water and long stretches of the seashore will make you come back to this place often more. If you live near Ongole, this can be a great destination for a family picnic or weekend getaway. Best Time to Visit:  October to March Famous for: This beach is mostly famous for Karthika Purnima festival 9. Appikonda Beach, Visakhapatnam source: staticflickr Appikonda is known as one of the best beaches in Andhra Pradesh. They achieved this position by maintaining cleanliness throughout the beach and nearby areas. Since this particular beach is far from Visakhapatnam city, it does not generally get overcrowded, unlike other beaches of Andhra Pradesh. Best Time to Visit:  October to March Famous for: Some popular activities and spots near this beach are as follows: Swimming Snorkelling Shiva Temple 10. Lawson’s Bay Beach, Visakhapatnam source: holidify Lawson’s Bay beach is just a continuation of Ramakrishna Beach. Walk around the beach, listen to the waves crashing on the shore and feel the breeze. It will definitely help you rejuvenate. Best Time to Visit: October to March Famous for: Some popular spots near this beach are as follows: INS Kursura Submarine Museum Kailasagiri Peak Dolphin’s nose TU 142 Aircraft Museum 11. Manginapudi Beach, Krishna source: wikimedia Manginapudi is one of the top beaches in Andhra Pradesh. This is also locally known as the Bandar beach or Machilipatnam beach. Similar to Bheemili beach, here also you will find black soil. Manginapudi lights up during the occasion of Magha Purnima when pilgrims gather to take a holy bath in the sea. Best Time to Visit: February to March Famous for: A popular spot near this beach is an Old Lighthouse 12. Pakala Beach, Prakasam source: googleusercontent The list of the lesser-known beaches in Andhra Pradesh continues with Pakala beach. This village is located in the Prakasam district. Unlike other beaches, Pakala is not near any popular city, hence, the shore is not overcrowded but is clean and well-maintained. If you are searching for a beach for a laidback staycation, this can be an ideal location. Best Time to Visit: October to March Famous for: Some popular activities and spots near this beach are as follows: Swimming Surfing 13. Perupalem Beach, West Godavari source: jollydaytours Perupalem is located in the West Godavari district of the state. The efficient work of APTDC developed this beach for tourism purposes. If you visit here, you will be fascinated with the clear blue water. This beach serves as a great holiday destination for your family and kids. Moreover, Perupalem is famously known for hosting religious rituals like vana-bhojanam and holy bathing. Best Time to Visit: October to March Famous for: This beach is mostly famous for the following: Mery Matha church Perupalem beach festival 14. Vodarevu Beach, Bapatla source: madmansjourney Vodarevu is located around 8km away from Chirala. It is among the most visited beaches in this district. Hence the flow of tourists is fairly regular, mainly during the weekends. If you plan to visit here, remember to check out Suryalanka beach as well which is just 28 km from Vodarevu. Best Time to Visit: August to December Famous for: Some popular activities and spots near this beach are as follows: Water sports Swimming Boating in the sea Lighthouse 15. Uppada Beach, Kakinada source: holidify Clear water, white or silver sand and glittery water make Uppada beach more tempting. This is proclaimed as one of the safest beaches as its wide shoreline gradually inclines to the water. Those who are planning to visit here must not miss the sunrises and sunsets.  Best Time to Visit: October and March Famous for: Besides providing a pleasant experience this beach is mostly famous for the village near it due to: Weaving Fishery station 16. Krishnapatnam Beach, Nellore source: nitrocdn Krishnapatnam is among the most beautiful beaches in Nellore. This region is primarily known as a port town. The long stretch of the seashore, shadowed by palm trees on one side, seems like a painted landscape. Experiencing this natural and peaceful beach can offer unforgettable relief from mundane life. Best Time to Visit: October to March Famous for: Some popular spots near this beach are as follows: Ubbalamadugu Falls Pulicat Lake Ayyappa Temple Sitting back and watching the waves breaking on the shore is immensely therapeutic. There are two kinds of beaches in Andhra Pradesh, one which is popular and the other is less explored. Hopefully, the list helps you plan for your next trip. While choosing, make sure to check the distance from the main city to each of these beaches so that you can explore more places at once. FAQs about the Beaches in Andhra Pradesh All Which sea beach is the most visited in Andhra Pradesh? RK or Ramakrishna beach in Andhra Pradesh is one of the most visited sea beaches in the state. This is probably because it is located within the city and within walking distance from some of the popular resorts and hotels. RK or Ramakrishna beach in Andhra Pradesh is one of the most visited sea beaches in the state. This is probably because it is located within the city and within walking distance from some of the popular resorts and hotels. Which beaches in Andhra Pradesh are best for solo travellers? Those aspiring to go on a solo trip to Andhra Pradesh must visit Rishikonda, Ramakrishna, Yarada and Appikonda. Along with exploring the beaches, they can also check out the local museums and go trekking and camping as well. Those aspiring to go on a solo trip to Andhra Pradesh must visit Rishikonda, Ramakrishna, Yarada and Appikonda. Along with exploring the beaches, they can also check out the local museums and go trekking and camping as well. Which is the cleanest beach in Andhra Pradesh? Rishikonda Beach is the cleanest beach in Andhra Pradesh. Rishikonda Beach is the cleanest beach in Andhra Pradesh. Which Beach is famous for water activities in Andhra Pradesh? Ramkrishna Beach is the most famous beach for water activities in Andhra Pradesh. The beach offers water activities like swimming, surfing, and playing volleyball. Even One can enjoy a camel ride on the sands. Here, the fishers arrange traditional fishing boats, and one can even take a local cruise to enjoy the beautiful view of the sunset. There are a total of 21 beaches in Andhra Pradesh. There are a total of 21 beaches in Andhra Pradesh. What is coastal Andhra famous for? Coastal Andhra is famous for its rich agricultural land and abundant water supply. Rice grown in paddy fields is the main crop, with pulses and coconuts also being necessary. The fishing industry is also essential to the region. Coastal Andhra is famous for its rich agricultural land and abundant water supply. The best time to visit Andhra Pradesh is during the winter season, from November to February. The best time to visit Andhra Pradesh is during the winter season, from November to February. How do you reach Mypadu Beach from Nellore? You can reach Mypadu Beach within 50-60 minutes if you drive on SH 57(State Highway) from Nellore. Even tourists can reach the beach by road from Tirupati or Ongole, which is between 144 km and 155 km.  You can reach Mypadu Beach within 50-60 minutes if you drive on SH 57(State Highway) from Nellore. Ramapuram Beach is about 100 km from the city of Vijayawada, a clean and uninhabited beach. Ramapuram Beach is about 100 km from the city of Vijayawada, a clean and uninhabited beach. Which Railway Station is near Uppada Beach? Kakinada Railway station is near Uppada Beach, which is a distance of 22 km. Kakinada Railway station is near Uppada Beach, which is a distance of 22 km. Which beach is Best for Swimming? Rushikonda Beach and Bheemili (Bheemunipatnam Beach) are the best beaches in Andhra Pradesh for swimming. One of the lesser-known beaches near Vizag is Sagar Nagar Beach, where you will find very few people, which makes this beach calm and attractive.
